page.title: 04Clay Industry S/W Dartmoor.
page.content: W.B.B. stands for Watts, Blake and Bearne and the firm has a branch at { {Shaugh Lake.}We went there to see how they extract the clay. First we went to see the water monitor. It blasts the clay out of the stones and rocks. It has a pressure of 150 p.s.i. Next, it goes to the sand plant, where the sand and gravel are separated from the clay. This is screened into different grades and sold to builders etc. The clay goes into the thickener plant and travels through a series of cyclones which extracts any mica that is left in it. After this, chemicals are added to thicken the clay and clear the water. The clay is pumped to {Cornwood for further processing.At{Cornwood}it is dried and then either exported or sent to factories for the manufacture of other commodities.
